data.title: Very tasty food, ample portions in an "artsy" environment.
data.text:
We were referred to this particular restaurant by the campground staff.  The restaurant walls feature paintings and framed photography that are for available for purchase.  Tasteful background music, very attentive staff and super clean eating area enhanced the charm of this little gem.
The food did not disappoint!  Portions were ample enough for two meals!
We both had the seafood platters.  A very generous salad came with the meal.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: I have been once before while visiting the area. Everything I have had has been very good. Quick and friendly service. You will definitely not leave hungry.

data.title: Ellen
data.text: We love this place.  The food is always good. The service is great. Don't go there expecting to be rushed. The table is yours until you decide your done.  Very relaxed atmosphere. Breakfast ,(on weekends) lunch and dinner.  One of our favorite place to go.

data.title: good grub
data.text: I have eaten here three times now, not fine dinning but good consistent food. Barbeque, fresh local stuff, burgers and fries, reasonable prices. I like it.

data.title: Good atmosphere
data.text: They have some dishes that are inexpensive, & other mid range dishes of seafood, plus steak, & good service. My wife & I always enjoy eating there.

data.title: Big disappointment
data.text:
We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon. The place was nearly empty with a lot of employees hanging around.
Limited menu. Food not cooked properly. Waitress did not come back after delivering food. No refills. 
We requested check, paid and left. Will never return

data.title: Gets Better Each Time We Go
data.text: I had an appointment just down the street and had lunch at the Plaid Turnip. My husband and I love this place. Cute inside with booths tables and a bar. The owner is on site and knows how to prepare food. Some people have the pallet to understand how to combine flavors. Ed is a true chef and not just a cook. We love their breakfasts and lunches. Omlettes are outstanding and I like the Main Street that is stuffed with vegetables and cheese. Eggs are whipped by machine to make them fuller. The club is hot and has GREAT flavor. I like their salads that have pieces of corn along with fresh vegetables. Burgers are huge!  Ribs are so tender. Specials every day (meatloaf great). Staff friendly and efficient. Prices good as for 2 the club, side and beverages only $22.  We travel 45 minutes to go to this restaurant from Smithfield and it is so worth it! A must try!

data.title: Good food terrible service
data.text:
There were 7 of us there for a late lunch.  It took a while for the food to be served and when it was, it came out one plate at a time with 3-5 minutes in between each one served. Two of us got our food after she took the order from another table.  I have never seen a waitress go to another table to take an order while our table was not completely served. It was not as if they were supper busy either. There were many empty tables.
The food was great but service not so good.

data.title: Iced out!!
data.text: Reserved a table for 10 on Sunday 8/14/2016 2:00p.m. Arrived and table was ready, but the inside temperature, was unpleasantly warm. Waitress came to take drink orders, and we could use something cool to drink...guess what?? No ice! What? 80 + degrees inside, and no ice. She did apologize and said their ice machine was down. What??? So somebody go out and get some ice, and an a/c repairman. All 10 of us left. How much money did they lose that day over these 2 things, more than a few bags of ice, that's for sure. A/C and ice. 2 vital things a restaurant needs if it's 100 degrees outside, which it was.

data.title: Supper Menu
data.text: I ordered the roasted turkey on a biscuit with gravy, cranberry sauce, and two sides for about $11.00. What a deal! It was like Thanksgiving! I could barely finish eating all of it. Plus, the service at night is prompt and friendly.

data.title: Where is the management?
data.text: We had reservations for 10 family members on Saturday night on our way to the Outer Banks. Our reservation was for 7:00. We arrived on time. There were empty tables everywhere. We waited a half hour to be seated. The hostess was out to lunch. The adults ordered a bottle of wine which took a long time coming. We asked  about the wine and were told wine glasses needed to be washed. The wine came with glasses that had to be turned over for the water to run out. The waitress did not know how to open a bottle of wine. She appeared to have had no training for her job. The restaurant was almost empty by the time we ordered but it took a long time to get our food. The 4 children in our party were starving. Some of the food we ordered was very good. I had the fried Oysters Rockefeller which was delicious. My husband had fried Flounder which he said was the best he'd ever eaten. But my son had blackened Flounder that was not eatable. $4.00 was taken off the bill for his meal. The evening was a frustrating experience!

data.title: Good Restaurant In DownTown Suffolk
data.text: My wife and I have visited about 6 times in the last 12 months. We like the feel of the place, the food we ordered has always been satisfactory, the staff is nice and professional. For us, this is a decent place for your family and friends.and a place to have a celebration..

data.title: Okay place to eat
data.text: The Plaid Turnip is an interesting place to eat and meet friends. The food is filling and the service is good. I don't recommend the bacon

data.title: Simply Outstanding Food
data.text: We used to frequent this establishment when it was called Picies and the food was top shelf back then. We opted to try it out today and we are so happy we did. We could not remember the previous restaurant name until our server, Vicky , reminded us. Along with a management  and name change it is not much different except for maybe some additions to the menu. We picked out a couple burgers and, get this, they are 2/3 pound each, yes 2/3 lb. They were cooked perfectly and served with the home made potato chips which were just as excellent. They were hard to finish because of the size but worth every bite. We were suprised that there were not more people downtown and especially in this restaurant. This is a hidden gem in downtown Suffolk. Our server Vicky was very very good and made sure we were happy. The menu prices are very reasonable and even though we live in the northern part of the city it is worth the drive. We are going to tell our friends about the place and plan on returning again and again. You owe it to yourself to visit the Plaid Turnip.

data.title: Good Breakfast Place
data.text:
While visiting Suffolk, we decided to eat breakfast at The Plaid Turnip.  The name is just so catchy we couldn't resist.  We figured we'd get a good southern breakfast;  we did.  The reason why we didn't rate 5 stars was because my scrambled eggs didn't taste or look like real eggs. They were this weird totally yellow, no whites concoction.  Are they powdered?  Yuck!  But, the grits and pan sausage were especially good.  The hash brown casserole was delicious, very cheesy and the fluffy pancake was perfect.  The pancake was so good, I did not use syrup; I ate it plain. 

Our server was very attentive and friendly.  The paintings on the walls helped strike up conversation.  My husband and I sang along to the oldies music playing over the PA.  We'll be back before we leave Suffolk.  However, next time, I'll order my eggs fried.

data.title: Very Enjoyable
data.text: Visited a couple of years ago and it was OK, much more pleased with this visit.  Waitress was enthusiastic, food was quick.  I wish they had cold iceberg on the wedge tonight, but they were out.  Wife got the Buttermilk Chicken and was in heaven.  I got the BBQ platter and it was portioned well.  Slaw was best I've gotten in while.  I think the prices were fair.  Well worth coming back.

data.title: Very Enjoyable!
data.text: Enjoyed lunch here yesterday: the food was very good, service was great (there were 8-9 in our party), and the overall environment was so pleasant. They have lots of local art on the walls and it just felt "homey" rather than bare and bland.

data.title: Disappointing Visit
data.text: We have visited several times for breakfast.  The first few times, it was outstanding.  The omelettes are huge and served with your choice of sides.  The hash brown casserole was great.  You will take some home as portions of food are big.  This last time, we were really disappointed.  The waiter took forever to bring coffee.  He would come out of the kitchen with one plate for a table, see us and go back to kitchen.  He finally did give us coffee but it took another forever for him to come back and take our order.  It's disappointing that people who come in after you get their order before you (and they ordered eggs as well).  When we finally got our food, the taste was different from our previous visits.  The waiter never checked on us again until we were done and then he brought the check.  Our recent experience wasn't great but it might have been just a bad day.  We haven't returned.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Have eaten here very many times and have always been pleased.  Good food and served quickly.  I would definitely recommend this place.

data.title: We enjoyed our dinner very much.
data.text: Service was great, but few diners on this week night.  Vicky gave us lots of attention.  Food came in a timely manner and we were all happy with the meal.
